Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Looking at the scenario there are 10 activities listed IG DD TFC CE PC LT UT AG MP FL

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: The initial step is Idea Generation IG Since it is the starting point I will set init with IGs support and confidence as 10

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Activities that start after IG For example Design Draft DD might have response to IG since after IG they move to DD Similarly Technical Feasibility Check TFC might have response to DD

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Next for successful cases Lets check dependencies After Cost Evaluation CE comes Prototype Creation PC so CE might have succession to PC Then Laboratory Testing LT via chainresponse to PC User Testing UT via chainresponse to LT Then Approval Gate AG as response to UT Marketing Plan MP as response to AG Finally Final Launch FL as response to MP

Name: Backtracking - IND
Text: for some activities like Dualisms maybe replace CE with GT but according to the scenario CE is after TFC So CEs response to PC makes sense

Name: Validation - PE
Text: Doublecheck the keys For example after approval Marketing Plan MP is initiated which then leads to FL So MP has response to AG and FL to MP

Name: Heuristic Reasoning - IND
Text: check for any alternative paths The scenario doesnt mention alternatives so maybe ignore keys like altresponse etc Unless the user expects some basic structure but since not mentioned probably stick to the main paths

Name: Deductive Reasoning - NE
Text: Wait the users prompt says For the keys respondedexistence etc the value is a dictionary containing as keys the activities and as corresponding value the support 10 and confidence of the declarative rule But that doesnt seem right Maybe its a mistake Because in standard DECLARE models the links are usually between two activities

Name: Abductive Reasoning - IND
Text: This is confusing but given the instruction I will proceed as per their instruction even if its confusing So each links dict will have activities as keys and a dict of support and confidence
